content:
This is a nice, but quite hard clash.

A few suggestions to help make it more solvable in time:
1. "Rounding to the thousandth" is quite confusing here, since we are in scientific notation. It would be a lot more straight-forward to say "round to 3 decimal places, without trailing zeroes". In my clash I thought you meant something more complicated until the end.
2. Some more test cases would be helpful. Especially since your only test/validator less than 1e3 is a validator, so clashers don't get to practice how to solve these in-clash. Further, none of your tests or validators cover the "Billion", "Quadrillion" or "Sextillion" cases, so more tests are needed to fully ensure clashers have solved your problem.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Le défi est intéressant et implique plusieurs petites difficultés intéressantes à relever !
fun little challenge, clear instructions, it was fun to solve!

❌ Rejected the contribution.
Comment: Too much hardcoding not fun to solve.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting and fun to do.

(a) Please remove the ending "-s" from ALL the units  ("Millions", "Billions", "Trillions", etc). You don't need the plural form.

https://www.eslcafe.com/resources/grammar-lessons/saying-numbers/writing-and-saying-large-numbers

https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/English_numerals

(b) Please make each pair of test and validator similar.

For example, currently you have two tests on million, but no validators on million; and no tests on <1 million, but 1 validator on <1 million.

See General Guidelines point 4:
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/contribution-guidelines

(c) Please specify that no rounding to the thousand is required if the given number is under 1 million.

(d) Wrong spelling: Octollion => Octillion

(e) Output section: Please change "his" to "its".

(f) Please define all the units - the players are not expected to know the words and not expected to search online during a clash.

(g) Having Reverse Mode enabled for this clash does not seem to be a good idea to me, especially when there are not adequate test cases for the player to know which words he/she will need to include in the code.

Thanks.

(a) fixed
(b) fixed
(c) nowhere is it specified that you have to round to the thousand
(d) fixed
(e) fixed
(f) fixed
(g) fixed

(c) You may specify it as part of the last sentence in Goal section.

(f) By definition, I mean explain what million, billion, etc mean, e.g. million is 10^6.

Please also fix "{Million}}" as "{{Million}}".

Thanks.
